sec.p: Spartina pectinata is widespread across much of North America north of Mexico, distributed in southern Alberta, eastern Washington and Oregon, south to Texas, and east to Newfoundland and Labrador ( Barkworth 2003). It grows in marshes, slough and floodplains, in dry prairies and along roads ( Barkworth 2003). It is known from a few scattered sites in Britain and Ireland where it has been introduced and escaped from cultivation ( Cope and Gray 2009).
